subject: Sleep
title: Sleep Spindles and Memory
description: One-minute skill: Sleep Spindles and Memory.

hook.text: Half-second bursts of brain activity fire 12 to 14 times per second during N2 sleep. They're building memories.

buildup.text: Sleep spindles are generated by the thalamus and broadcast across the cortex in rhythmic pulses.

discovery.text: They help transfer information from short-term to long-term memory storage during the night.

twist.text: Students tested after learning new material show increased spindle activity that same night.

climax.text: Boosting spindles artificially in experiments improved memory test scores the following morning.

punchline.text: Sleep spindles are your brain's save button.

quiz.question: What role do sleep spindles play in memory?
options: They transfer information to long-term storage
